title: Chapter 32: Alma 40–42
content: In this scripture block, Alma teaches his son Corianton about individual agency and eternal rewards and consequences. As students discuss these teachings, they will be reminded that “wickedness never was happiness” (

) and that righteousness never brings misery. They will see that the choices they make on the earth will determine their degree of happiness after death. You can help students understand the role Jesus Christ can play in meeting the demands of justice. As we choose to repent and follow Him, we benefit from the plan of mercy and progress toward eternal happiness.
